answers.answer: I've had the same thing. My dr said knee high compression stockings, elevate your feet and drink water. It's really helped.
My were so painful the other day i put them in ice water for as long as i could stand it. Helped for the pain a little. Put them up as well
Yes and the only thing that helps is propping them up, staying off of them as much as possible and drinking water.
Cold ice packs, keep them up and lot of water, helpsed some with my first child. But my feet hurt so bad the skin was stretching ugh. It was horrible. Delivery my son was the true cure.
Freeze a water bottle and once frozen, put it on the floor and roll it under your foot.. one at a time it really helps.

You need to get it checked out by your doctor.  Could be a sign of preeclampsia or it could just be normal swelling. I had that problem last week. Luckily mine checked out fine.  Have to wear compression socks daily now. Was also told to rest as much as I can and drink more water.
My doctor suggested eating lots of apples. She said it helps remove water from the right places :-)
Thanks for all the helpful tips

question: Anybody have swollen feet? My feet have been swollen for the past day & they bother me so much. What can I do to make it go away.
title: Any advice?
